intro: Amelanchier alnifolia var. siskiyouensis, commonly known as the Siskiyou serviceberry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Pacific Northwest. It is characterized by its oval, dark green leaves and clusters of white flowers that appear in early spring. The plant produces edible berries in the summer, which are dark purple to black in color and have a sweet, tart flavor. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, open woodlands. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
